item.title: How to Install MariaDB on a Raspberry Pi
item.description: This article covers how to install and configure MariaDB, a feature-equivalent alternative to MySQL, on a Raspberry Pi. Installing is relatively straightforward. Configuring the database is somewhat more involved but still quite manageable. The full text of this article can be found on Medium This is the sixth and final article in the Develop and Deploy Kubernetes Applications on a Raspberry Pi Cluster series. It marks the transition from a purely Raspberry Pi focus to software development more generally.
